thread.title: Lee holds off West Georgia, UNG 4th at LeeAnn Noble tourney
thread.title_full: Lee holds off West Georgia, UNG 4th at LeeAnn Noble tourney

author: AccessWDUN staff
title: Lee holds off West Georgia, UNG 4th at LeeAnn Noble tourney
text:
By AccessWDUN staff Related Articles Salgado leads UNG men's soccer to shutout win over Shorter No. 2 UNG women's soccer battles to scoreless draw vs. Armstrong Lenoir-Rhyne scores golden goal to knock off N. Georgia men No. 11 Lady Nighthawks sweep road trip with win over Lees-McRae 
DAHLONEGA — The Flames of Lee University held off a charge from West Georgia to claim the 2nd Annual LeeAnn Noble Memorial Golf Tournament team title by a single stroke on Tuesday afternoon on the par 72, 5,887 yard Achasta Golf Course. Lee's Caroline Moore earned individual medalist honors with a one-under 72-71-143. 
Moore's 36-hole score set a new tournament scoring record as the Flames' team score of 609 also set a new tournament benchmark. 
Franziska Bremm (West Georgia), Savannah Payne (West Alabama), Stephanie Bennett (West Georgia), Sam Burrus (Lee) and Hannah Solesbee (North Georgia) joined Moore on the All-Tournament Team. 
West Georgia (610) posted a new tournament record single round team score of 300 in the final round and fell just a stroke shy of Lee for first place. West Alabama finished third with a 624. 
UNG held its spot with a final round 324 to finish fourth out of nine teams with a 316-624-640. 
Solesbee was the Nighthawks' top scorer for the second consecutive day as the freshman followed up her opening round 73 with a four-over 77 for a 150, good for a tie for fifth out of 56 golfers. 
The second annual event is being held to honor LeeAnn Noble, a member of the UNG women's golf team that passed away in March of 2014 following a lengthy battle with heart complications. 
North Georgia wraps up the fall portion of the schedule when the team travels to St. Augustine, Fla. to take part in the Flagler Fall Slam.
